text:
I'm trying to deploy the documentation of my package on GitHub Actions. But I'm getting the following error:
```Failed to add the RSA host key for IP address 'XXXX' to the list of known hosts (/home/runner/.ssh/known_hosts). 

Load key "/home/runner/work/VegaGraphs.jl/VegaGraphs.jl/docs/.documenter": invalid format 

<mailto:git@github.com|git@github.com>: Permission denied (publickey). 

 fatal: Could not read from remote repository.```
Any ideas on what I could be doing wrong?

elements.text: I'm trying to deploy the documentation of my package on GitHub Actions. But I'm getting the following error:

Failed to add the RSA host key for IP address 'XXXX' to the list of known hosts (/home/runner/.ssh/known_hosts). 

Load key "/home/runner/work/VegaGraphs.jl/VegaGraphs.jl/docs/.documenter": invalid format 

git@github.com: Permission denied (publickey). 

 fatal: Could not read from remote repository.
Any ideas on what I could be doing wrong?

text: Your key probably does not have write permission.

elements.text: Your key probably does not have write permission.

text: But the repo is mine. So I should have...

elements.text: But the repo is mine. So I should have...

text: The deploy key might not have.

elements.text: The deploy key might not have.

text: Do I need to manually generate the deploykey?

elements.text: Do I need to manually generate the deploykey?

text: In the Documenter.jl manual, it looked like GitHub Actions would take care of it. And I would only need to do it if I was using Travis.

elements.text: In the Documenter.jl manual, it looked like GitHub Actions would take care of it. And I would only need to do it if I was using Travis.

text: The error is from the ssh code path so it seems like you have opted for that

elements.text: The error is from the ssh code path so it seems like you have opted for that

text: Yep! Thanks, it was that. I removed the line referencing ssh, and it worked
